Description: Leaf/grain amaranth cultivar used for greens or seed.
GrowingAdvice: Direct sow after last frost; thin to 6–10 in; harvest baby greens 3–5 weeks.
GreenhouseInstructions: Start 2–4 weeks early for transplants if season is short; harden off before planting.
Pests: Flea beetles, aphids; birds on seedheads.
Amendments: Compost at bed prep; side‑dress nitrogen lightly midseason.

Description: Perennial spear crop from crowns; spring harvest.
GrowingAdvice: Plant crowns in early spring; do not harvest first year; full harvest from year 3.
TransplantAge: Crowns in early spring; seedlings 10–12 wks indoor
GreenhouseInstructions: Start seedlings in plugs 10–12 weeks before last frost if growing from seed; transplant after frost.
SoilInfo: Deep sandy loam; pH 6.5–7.5; high organic matter; good drainage.
Amendments: Heavy compost annually; balanced organic fertilizer in spring.

Description: Dry shell bean for storage and soups.
GrowingAdvice: Direct sow after soil 60°F; 3–4 in spacing; keep evenly moist until emergence.

Amendments: Inoculate with rhizobia; light compost; avoid excess N.

Description: Snap bean for fresh pods.
GrowingAdvice: Succession sow every 2–3 weeks after frost for steady harvest.
GreenhouseInstructions: Not typically transplanted; direct sow.
SoilInfo: Loam; pH 6.2–7.2; consistent moisture during flowering.
Amendments: Rhizobia inoculant; compost at planting.

Description: Root beet; also edible greens.
GrowingAdvice: Direct sow early spring and late summer; thin to 3–4 in.
GreenhouseInstructions: Transplant in cells at 3–4 weeks if needed (minimize root disturbance).
SoilInfo: Loose loam/sandy loam; pH 6.2–7.0; even moisture.
Amendments: Compost; boron if deficient.

Description: Tall brassica producing sprouts along stem.
GrowingAdvice: Start indoors late spring; transplant for fall harvest.
TransplantAge: Start 6–8 wks before set‑out; transplant midsummer
GreenhouseInstructions: Start 4–6 weeks before transplant; plant out midsummer for fall.
Amendments: Heavy feeder; compost + organic N.

Description: Heading brassica for fresh or storage.
GrowingAdvice: Start indoors 4–6 weeks before last frost (spring) and midsummer for fall.
GreenhouseInstructions: Transplant at 4–6 weeks; harden off.
Amendments: Compost + organic N; lime if pH low.

Description: Asian brassica (napa/michihili/bok choy).
GrowingAdvice: Best as fall crop to avoid bolting; keep cool and moist.
GreenhouseInstructions: Transplant at 3–4 weeks; avoid root stress.
Amendments: Compost; mulch to keep cool.

GreenhouseInstructions: Transplant at 3–4 weeks; avoid root stress.
Amendments: Compost; mulch to keep cool.

Description: Leaf/petiole crop requiring steady moisture.
GrowingAdvice: Start indoors 10–12 weeks before last frost; transplant after danger of frost.
GreenhouseInstructions: Maintain even moisture and fertility; harden off well.
SoilInfo: Rich organic soil; pH 6.2–7.0; high moisture.
Amendments: Heavy feeder; compost + regular side‑dress with organic N.

Description: Indeterminate/determinate fruiting vine.
